original: avinivartanīyānāṃ ca bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ tāṃś cittotpādān anumodeta /
analyzed: a vinivartanīyānām ca bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tān citta utpādān anumodeta
translated: and rejoice in the thought of the irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas.

original: ekajātipratibaddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ tāṃś cittotpādān anumodeta /
analyzed: eka jāti pratibaddhānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tān citta utpādān anumodeta
translated: and rejoice in the thought of the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who are bound to one birth.

original: ity aparityaktasattvārthā nirūḍhir ity uktā nirūḍhiḥ
analyzed: iti aparityakta sattva arthā nirūḍhiḥ iti uktā nirūḍhiḥ
translated: Thus, the non-abandonment of the welfare of beings and the establishment have been explained. The establishment has been explained.

original: evam ukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Shakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: syāt kauśika cāturmahādvīpake lokadhātau palāgreṇa pramāṇaṃ na tv eva teṣām anumodanāsahagatānāṃś cittotpādānāṃ puṇyasya pramāṇaṃ /
analyzed: syāt kauśika cāturmahādvīpake lokadhātau pala agreṇa pramāṇam na tu eva teṣām anumodanā sahagatānām citta utpādānām puṇyasya pramāṇam
translated: Kausika, it is possible to measure the earth of the four continents with a tip of a hair, but not the merit of those thoughts accompanied by rejoicing.

original: tiṣṭhatu kauśika cāturdvīpako lokadhātur evaṃ sāhasro lokadhātur evaṃ dvisāhasro madhyamo lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhatu kauśika cāturdvīpakaḥ lokadhātuḥ evam sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ evam dvi sāhasraḥ madhyamaḥ lokadhātuḥ
translated: Let alone the four-continent world system, Kausika, let alone the thousand-world system, let alone the medium two-thousand-world system.

original: syāt khalu punaḥ kauśika trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau palāgreṇa pramāṇaṃ na tv eva teṣām anumodanāsahagatānāṃ cittotpādānāṃ puṇyasya pramāṇaṃ /
analyzed: syāt khalu punar kauśika tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau pala agreṇa pramāṇam na tu eva teṣām anumodanā sahagatānām citta utpādānām puṇyasya pramāṇam
translated: Kausika, it is possible to measure the earth of the great trichiliocosm with a tip of a hair, but not the merit of those thoughts accompanied by rejoicing.

original: syāt khalu punaḥ kauśika trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau mahāsamudreṣu śatadhā bhinnayā🔽vālāgrakoṭyā udakabindūnām utkṣipyamānānāṃ pramāṇaṃ na tv eva teṣām anumodanāsahagatānāṃ
analyzed: syāt khalu punar kauśika tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau mahā samudreṣu śatadhā bhinnayā  vāla agra koṭyāḥ udaka bindūnām utkṣipyamānānām pramāṇam na tu eva teṣām anumodanā sahagatānām
translated: Kauśika, it is possible to measure the water drops taken up by a hundredth part of the tip of a hair from the great oceans in the trichiliocosm, but not the merit of those who rejoice in those wholesome roots.

original: cittotpādānāṃ puṇyasya pramāṇam /
analyzed: citta utpādānām puṇyasya pramāṇam
translated: Kauśika, it is possible that the number of water drops taken up by a hair-tip split into a hundred parts from the great oceans in the trichiliocosm could be known, but not the amount of merit from those thoughts of rejoicing accompanied by the wholesome roots.

original: evam ukte śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /🔽mārādhiṣṭhitās te bhagavan sattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat  māra dhiṣṭhitāḥ te bhagavan sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One:

original: ya imāṃś cittotpādān nānumodiṣyante / mārapakṣikās te bhagavan sattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ye imān citta utpādān na anumodiṣyante māra pakṣikāḥ te bhagavan sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Blessed One, those beings who will not rejoice in these thoughts will be possessed by Māra.

original: mārabhavanāt te bhagavan sattvāś cyutā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: māra bhavanāt te bhagavan sattvāḥ cyutāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Blessed One, those beings will be on Māra's side.🔽Blessed One, those beings who will not rejoice in these thoughts will have fallen from Māra's abode.

original: ya imāṃś cittotpādān nānumodiṣyante / mārabhavanāt te bhagavan sattvā ihāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ye imān citta utpādān na anumodiṣyante māra bhavanāt te bhagavan sattvāḥ iha āgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Blessed One, those beings who will not rejoice in these thoughts will have come here from Māra's abode.

original: ya imāṃś cittotpādān nānumodiṣyante / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽mārabhavanavidhvaṃsanakarās te bhagavan sattvā /
analyzed: ye imān citta utpādān na anumodiṣyante tat kasya hetoḥ  māra bhavana vidhvaṃsana karāḥ te bhagavan sattvāḥ
translated: Why is it so?

original: yair ime cittotpādā abhinirhṛtā /
analyzed: yaiḥ ime citta utpādāḥ abhinirhṛtā
translated: Blessed One, those beings who have produced these thoughts are destroyers of Māra's abode.

original: ye 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayanti / anumoditavyās te bhagavaṃś cittotpādā /
analyzed: ye nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayanti anumoditavyāḥ te bhagavan citta utpādāḥ
translated: Those who dedicate to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, those thoughts of theirs, Blessed One, should be rejoiced in.

original: ye 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpādayanti / yair aparityakto buddho 'parityakto dharmo 'parityaktaḥ saṃghas /
analyzed: ye nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayanti yaiḥ a parityaktaḥ buddhaḥ parityaktaḥ dharmo parityaktaḥ saṃghaḥ
translated: Those who arouse thoughts for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, who have not abandoned the Buddha, who have not abandoned the Dharma, who have not abandoned the Saṅgha,

original: tair ime cittotpādā /
analyzed: taiḥ ime citta utpādāḥ
translated: by them these thoughts

original: anumodyānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayitavyā yathā na dvayaḥ saṃjñī nādvayaḥ saṃjñī /
analyzed: anumodya anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayitavyāḥ yathā na dvayaḥ saṃjñī na advayaḥ saṃjñī
translated: should be rejoiced in and dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, without the perception of duality, without the perception of non-duality.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat kauśikaivam etat /
analyzed: evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: It is so, Kauśika, it is so.

original: yathā tvaṃ vadasi /
analyzed: yathā tvam vadasi
translated: As you say.

original: ya imān kauśika cittotpādān anumodiṣyante te kṣipraṃ tathāgatam arhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddham
analyzed: ye imān kauśika citta utpādān anumodiṣyante te kṣipram tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham
translated: Those, Kauśika, who will rejoice in these thoughts, they will quickly please the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: ārāgayiṣyanti ārāgayitvā na virāgayiṣyanti / evaṃ te ebhir anumodanāsahagataiś cittotpādakuśalamūlaiḥ
analyzed: ārāgayiṣyanti ārāgayitvā na virāgayiṣyanti evam te ebhiḥ anumodanā sahagataiḥ citta utpāda kuśala mūlaiḥ
translated: Having pleased him, they will not displease him. Thus, endowed with these wholesome roots of thought that are accompanied by rejoicing,

original: samanvāgatā yatra yatropapatsyante tatra tatra satkṛtā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: samanvāgatāḥ yatra yatra upapatsyante tatra tatra satkṛtāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: wherever they are reborn, there they will be honored.

original: gurukṛtā mānitāḥ pūjitā arcitā apacāyitā bhaviṣyanti / tatra te na jātv amanaāpāni rūpāṇi drakṣyanti /
analyzed: gurukṛtāḥ mānitāḥ pūjitāḥ arcitāḥ apacāyitāḥ bhaviṣyanti tatra te na jātu amanaāpāni rūpāṇi drakṣyanti
translated: They will be honored, revered, respected, and worshipped by their gurus. There they will never see unpleasant forms,

original: nāmanaāpān śabdān śroṣyanti /🔽nāmanaāpān gandhān ghrāsyanti /🔽nāmanaāpān rasān āsvādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: nāmanaāpān śabdān śroṣyanti  nāmanaāpān gandhān ghrāsyanti  nāmanaāpān rasān āsvādayiṣyanti
translated: or hear unpleasant sounds,🔽or smell unpleasant smells,🔽or taste unpleasant tastes,

original: nāmanaāpān spraṣṭavyān sprakṣyanti /
analyzed: nāmanaāpān spraṣṭavyān sprakṣyanti
translated: or touch unpleasant touchables,

original: nāmanaāpān dharmān vijñāsyanti / na ca te jātu buddhair bhagavadbhir virahitā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: nāmanaāpān dharmān vijñāsyanti na ca te jātu buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ virahitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: or cognize unpleasant dharmas. And they will never be separated from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: buddhakṣetreṇa ca buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: buddhakṣetreṇa ca buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: They will go from Buddha-field to Buddha-field.

original: tāṃś ca buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsiṣyante /
analyzed: tān ca buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsiṣyante
translated: They will attend on those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: kuśalamūlañ cāvaropayiṣyanti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kuśala mūlam ca avaropayiṣyanti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: They will plant wholesome roots. Why is that?

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhiś cāsaṃkhyeyānām aprameyāṇām aparimāṇānāṃ
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ ca asaṃkhyeyānām aprameyāṇām aparimāṇānām
translated: Because those sons and daughters of good family have rejoiced in the wholesome roots of innumerable, incalculable, immeasurable

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ navayānasaṃprasthitānāṃ kuśalamūlāny anumoditāny anumodyānuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām nava yāna saṃprasthitānām kuśala mūlāni anumoditāni anumodya anuttarāyām
translated: bodhisattvas, great beings who have newly set out in the vehicle, and having rejoiced, have dedicated them to unsurpassed,

original: samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmitāni /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmitāni
translated: perfect enlightenment.

original: prathamabhūmisthitānāṃ kuśalamūlāny anumoditāni /
analyzed: prathama bhūmi sthitānām kuśala mūlāni anumoditāni
translated: The wholesome roots of those established in the first stage are rejoiced in.

original: dvitīyabhūmisthitānāṃ yāvad daśabhūmisthitānāṃ yāvad ekajātipratibaddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ tāni kuśalamūlāny anumoditāni /
analyzed: dvitīya bhūmi sthitānām yāvat daśa bhūmi sthitānām yāvat eka jāti pratibaddhānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tāni kuśala mūlāni anumoditāni
translated: The wholesome roots of those established in the second stage up to those established in the tenth stage, up to the bodhisattvas, the great beings who are bound to one birth, are rejoiced in.

original: taiś ca kuśalamūlair vibaddhamānair anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodher abhyāsī bhavanti /
analyzed: taiḥ ca kuśala mūlaiḥ vibaddha mānaiḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ abhyāsī bhavanti
translated: By being bound to those wholesome roots, they approach unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: te 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyāprameyān asaṃkhyeyān aparimāṇasattvān parinirvāpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: te nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān aparimāṇa sattvān parinirvāpayiṣyanti
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, they will bring to complete nirvana immeasurable, incalculable, innumerable beings.

original: tad anena kauśika paryāyeṇa tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prathamacittotpādikānāṃ
analyzed: tat anena kauśika paryāyeṇa tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā prathama citta utpādikānām
translated: By this method, Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family,

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ tāni kuśalamūlāny anumodyānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayitavyāni /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tāni kuśala mūlāni anumodya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayitavyāni
translated: having rejoiced in those wholesome roots of the bodhisattvas, the great beings who have produced the first thought of enlightenment, should transform them into unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tathā ca pariṇāmayitavyāni yathā tac cittam anyatra cittena caren nānyatra cittena / ity uktā cittasaṃsthitiḥ
analyzed: tathā ca pariṇāmayitavyāni yathā tat cittam anyatra cittena caret na anyatra cittena iti uktā citta saṃsthitiḥ
translated: And they should be transformed in such a way that that thought moves with the mind elsewhere, not with the mind elsewhere. Thus the stability of mind is explained.

original: avinivartanīyānām ekajātipratibaddhānāṃ tāni kuśalamūlāny anumodyānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayitavyāni /
analyzed: a vinivartanīyānām eka jāti pratibaddhānām tāni kuśala mūlāni anumodya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayitavyāni
translated: Having rejoiced in those wholesome roots of the irreversible ones who are bound to one birth, they should be dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tathā ca pariṇāmayitavyāni yathā na dvayasaṃjñā nādvayasaṃjñā / iti sakalapravṛttipakṣādhiṣṭhānaḥ prathamo grāhyavikalpaḥ
analyzed: tathā ca pariṇāmayitavyāni yathā na dvaya saṃjñā na advaya saṃjñā iti sakala pravṛtti pakṣa adhiṣṭhānaḥ prathamaḥ grāhya vikalpaḥ
translated: And they should be dedicated in such a way that there is no notion of duality, no notion of non-duality. Thus, the first conceptualization regarding the object to be abandoned, which is based on the entire side of engagement,

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtiṃ sthaviram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim sthaviram etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Venerable Elder Subhūti:

original: kiṃ punar āyuṣman subhūte prajñāpāramitaivāvikalpā /
analyzed: kim punar āyuṣman subhūte prajñāpāramitā eva avikalpā
translated: Venerable Subhūti, is only the perfection of wisdom non-conceptual?

original: utāho dhyānapāramitāpy avikalpā /🔽vīryapāramitāpy avikalpā /
analyzed: uta aho dhyāna pāramitā api avikalpā  vīrya pāramitā api avikalpā
translated: Or are the perfection of concentration,🔽the perfection of perseverance,

original: kṣāntipāramitāpy avikalpā /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitā api avikalpā
translated: the perfection of patience,

original: śīlapāramitāpy avikalpā /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā api avikalpā
translated: the perfection of morality,

original: dānapāramitāpy avikalpā /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā api avikalpā
translated: and the perfection of giving also non-conceptual?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: avikalpā āyuṣman śāriputra prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: avikalpā āyuṣman śāriputra prajñāpāramitā
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom is non-conceptual.

original: avikalpā dhyānapāramitā /🔽avikalpā vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: avikalpā dhyāna pāramitā  avikalpā vīrya pāramitā
translated: The perfection of concentration is non-conceptual.🔽The perfection of perseverance is non-conceptual.

original: avikalpā kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: avikalpā kṣānti pāramitā
translated: The perfection of patience is non-conceptual.

original: avikalpā śīlapāramitā /
analyzed: avikalpā śīla pāramitā
translated: The perfection of morality is non-conceptual.

original: avikalpā āyuṣman śāriputra dānapāramitā /

analyzed: ākāśa tuccha tayā sattva tuccha tā draṣṭavyā iti anena api deva putrāḥ paryāyeṇa
translated: By this method, Devaputras, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva

original: bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yo 'saṃvidyamānānāṃ sattvānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ saṃnāhaṃ saṃnahyate
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yaḥ saṃvidyamānānām sattvānām kṛtaśas saṃnāham saṃnahyate
translated: who dons the armor for the sake of non-existent beings,

original: ākāśena sārdhaṃ sa vivaditavyaṃ manyeta yaḥ sattvānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ saṃnāhaṃ saṃnaddhavyaṃ manyeta /
analyzed: ākāśena sārdham sa vivaditavyam manyeta yaḥ sattvānām kṛtaśas saṃnāham saṃnaddhavyam manyeta
translated: He who thinks that he should dispute with space, he thinks that he should don the armor for the sake of beings.

original: sa ca saṃnāhaḥ saṃnaddho bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sattvāś ca nopalabhyante yeṣām arthāya saṃnāhaḥ saṃnaddhaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sa ca saṃnāhaḥ saṃnaddhaḥ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sattvāḥ ca na upalabhyante yeṣām arthāya saṃnāhaḥ saṃnaddhaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And that armor is donned by the bodhisattva mahāsattva, but beings for whose sake the armor is donned are not apprehended. Why is that?

original: sattvaviviktatayā saṃnāhaviviktatā draṣṭavyā / saced evaṃ bhāṣyamāṇe bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na saṃsīdati carati prajñāpāramitāyām / tat kasya
analyzed: sattva vivikta tayā saṃnāha vivikta tā draṣṭavyā saced evam bhāṣyamāṇe bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na saṃsīdati carati prajñāpāramitāyām tat kasya
translated: The isolation of the armor should be seen as the isolation of beings. If, when this is being taught, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become discouraged, he practices the perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: rūpaviviktatayā sattvaviviktatā /
analyzed: rūpa vivikta tayā sattva vivikta tā
translated: Because of the isolation of form, the isolation of beings.

original: vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskāravijñānaviviktatayā sattvaviviktatā /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra vijñāna vivikta tayā sattva vivikta tā
translated: Because of the isolation of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness, the isolation of beings.

original: prajñāpāramitāviviktatayā rūpaviviktatā yāvad vistareṇa sarvākārajñatāviviktatā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā vivikta tayā rūpa vivikta tā yāvat vistareṇa sarva ākāra jña tā vivikta tā
translated: Because of the isolation of the perfection of wisdom, the isolation of form, and so on in detail up to the isolation of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sacet punar bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarvadharmaviviktatāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ cittaṃ
analyzed: saced punar bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarva dharma vivikta tāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām cittam
translated: If, when the isolation of all phenomena is being taught, the mind of the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: nāvalīyate na saṃlīyate na saṃtrāsam āpadyate /
analyzed: na avalīyate na saṃlīyate na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: does not become cowed, does not become stolid, does not become terrified,

original: carati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām / iti dravyasatpṛthagjanapuruṣādhiṣṭhānaḥ prathamo grāhakavikalpaḥ
analyzed: carati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām iti dravya sat pṛthagjana puruṣa adhiṣṭhānaḥ prathamaḥ grāhaka vikalpaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom. Thus is the first grasping-discrimination, based on the substantially existent ordinary person.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kena kāraṇena subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na saṃsīdati prajñāpāramitāyā /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na saṃsīdati prajñāpāramitāyāḥ
translated: Subhūti, for what reason does the bodhisattva mahāsattva not become discouraged in the perfection of wisdom?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: asattvād bhagavan na saṃsīdati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: asattvāt bhagavat na saṃsīdati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become discouraged in the perfection of wisdom because of non-existence.

original: viviktatvāc chāntatvād anutpādatvād bhagavan na saṃsīdati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: vivikta tvāt śānta tvāt anutpāda tvāt bhagavat na saṃsīdati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become discouraged in the perfection of wisdom because of seclusion, peace, and non-arising.

original: anena bhagavan kāraṇena bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na saṃsīdati prajñāpāramitāyām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: anena bhagavan kāraṇena bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na saṃsīdati prajñāpāramitāyām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Blessed One, for this reason the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become discouraged in the perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: tathā hi bhagavan sa nopalabhyate yaḥ saṃsīdate / yena /
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan sa na upalabhyate yaḥ saṃsīdate yena
translated: Blessed One, it is because one who becomes discouraged, by whom,

original: vā saṃsīdate yatra vā saṃsīdate sarva ete dharmā nopalabhyante / saced bhagavann evaṃ
analyzed: vā saṃsīdate yatra vā saṃsīdate sarve ete dharmāḥ na upalabhyante saced bhagavan evam
translated: or in whom one becomes discouraged - all these dharmas are not apprehended. If, Blessed One, one were to become discouraged

original: bhāṣyamāṇe bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na saṃsīdati na viṣīdati nāvalīyate na saṃlīyate
analyzed: bhāṣyamāṇe bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na saṃsīdati na viṣīdati na avalīyate na saṃlīyate
translated: When this is being taught, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become discouraged, does not become disheartened, does not become cowed, does not become stolid,

original: nottrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate carati prajñāpāramitāyām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na uttrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate carati prajñāpāramitāyām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: does not tremble, does not become frightened, does not become terrified, and practices the perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: tathā hi bhagavan sarva ete dharmā nopalabhyante yo vā saṃsīdet yena vā saṃsīdet yatra vā saṃsīdet /
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan sarve ete dharmāḥ na upalabhyante yaḥ vā saṃsīdet yena vā saṃsīdet yatra vā saṃsīdet
translated: Because, Blessed One, all these dharmas are not apprehended, whether it is one who becomes discouraged, by whom one becomes discouraged, or where one becomes discouraged.

original: evaṃ carantaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ sendrakā devāḥ sabrahmakāḥ saprajāpatayo devā namasyanti yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati /
analyzed: evam carantam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam sa indrakāḥ devāḥ sa brahmakāḥ sa prajāpatayaḥ devāḥ namasyanti yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carati
translated: The gods with Indra, with Brahmā, with Prajāpati, the gods bow to the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this, who practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: na kevalaṃ subhūte sendrakair devaiḥ sabrahmakaiḥ saprajāpatikair devair namasyanīyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo ya evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati /
analyzed: na kevalam subhūte sa indrakaiḥ devaiḥ sa brahmakaiḥ sa prajāpatikaiḥ devaiḥ namasyanīyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yaḥ evam prajñāpāramitāyām carati
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom like this is not only to be bowed to by the gods with Indra, with Brahmā, with Prajāpati.

original: ye 'pi te 'tikrāntavarṇā devaputrāḥ śubhakṛtsnā vṛhatphalā yāvac chuddhāvāsakā devaputrās te 'pi subhūte namasyanti bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ
analyzed: ye pi te tikrāntavarṇāḥ deva putrāḥ śubhakṛtsnāḥ vṛhatphalāḥ yāvat śuddhāvāsakāḥ deva putrāḥ te pi subhūte namasyanti bodhisattvam mahāsattvam
translated: Those gods of the Pure Abodes, from the gods of the Śubhakṛtsna realm, the Bṛhatphala realm, up to the Śuddhāvāsa gods, they too, Subhūti, pay homage to the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: ya evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati /
analyzed: yaḥ evam prajñāpāramitāyām carati
translated: Those gods of the Pure Abodes, from the gods of the Suddhāvāsa class, the gods of the Bṛhatphala, the gods of the Atapa, the gods of the Sudarśana, the gods of the Akaniṣṭha, those gods of the Pure Abodes, also pay homage to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: ye 'pi te subhūte tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā asaṃkhyeyeṣv aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu
analyzed: ye pi te subhūte tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ asaṃkhyeyeṣu aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu
translated: Those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Samyaksaṃbuddhas who are in countless, immeasurable world systems,

original: tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti te 'pi subhūte tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhās🔽taṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran taṃ samanvāharanti / ayaṃ bodhisattvo
analyzed: tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti te pi subhūte tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ  tam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam prajñāpāramitāyām caran tam samanvāharanti ayam bodhisattvaḥ
translated: those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Samyaksaṃbuddhas, those Blessed Ones,🔽those Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom, they think of that Bodhisattva Mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom, 'This Bodhisattva Mahāsattva,

original: mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran dhyānapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyati /
analyzed: mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran dhyāna pāramitām paripūrayiṣyati
translated: practicing the perfection of wisdom, will perfect the perfection of concentration.

original: vīryapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyati /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitām paripūrayiṣyati
translated: He will perfect the perfection of perseverance.

original: kṣāntipāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyati /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitām paripūrayiṣyati
translated: He will perfect the perfection of patience.

original: śīlapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyati /
analyzed: śīla pāramitām paripūrayiṣyati
translated: He will perfect the perfection of morality.

original: dānapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyati /
analyzed: dāna pāramitām paripūrayiṣyati
translated: He will perfect the perfection of generosity.'

original: adhyātmaśūnyatāṃ paripūrayiṣyati yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ paripūrayiṣyati /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatām paripūrayiṣyati yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām paripūrayiṣyati
translated: He will perfect the emptiness of internal phenomena, and he will perfect the emptiness of external phenomena, and he will perfect the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, and he will perfect the emptiness of emptiness, and he will perfect the emptiness of great extent, and he will perfect the emptiness of ultimate reality, and he will perfect the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, and he will perfect the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, and he will perfect the emptiness of the unlimited, and he will perfect the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, and he will perfect the emptiness of non-rejection, and he will perfect the emptiness of inherent existence, and he will perfect the emptiness of all phenomena, and he will perfect the emptiness of non-apprehension, and he will perfect the emptiness of essential nature, and he will perfect the emptiness of essential nature with respect to non-apprehension.

original: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyān dharmān paripūrayiṣyati /
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyān dharmān paripūrayiṣyati
translated: He will perfect the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikābuddhadharmān paripūrayiṣyati yāvat sarvākārajñatāṃ paripūrayiṣyati /
analyzed: daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇikā buddha dharmān paripūrayiṣyati yāvat sarva ākārajña tām paripūrayiṣyati
translated: He will perfect the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed discernments, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, up to and he will perfect omniscience.

original: yāvat punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvān mahāsattvān buddhā bhagavantaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carataḥ samanvāharanti /
analyzed: yāvat punar subhūte bodhisattvān mahāsattvān buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ samanvāharanti
translated: To the extent, Subhūti, that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, pay attention to the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā buddhapratipannā dhārayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ buddha pratipannāḥ dhārayitavyāḥ
translated: those bodhisattva great beings should be known as following the Buddha.

original: yāvantaḥ subhūte gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvās te sarve mārāḥ pāpīyāṃso bhaveyur ekaikaś ca māraḥ pāpīyāṃs tāvata eva mārān pāpīyāso
analyzed: yāvantaḥ subhūte gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ te sarve mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ bhaveyuḥ ekaikaḥ ca māraḥ pāpīyān tāvataḥ eva mārān pāpīyāsaḥ
translated: Subhūti, all the beings in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Ganges River, if they were all to become Māra the wicked one, and each of those Māra the wicked ones

original: te sarve 'pratibalās tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato 'ntarāyaṃ kartum /
analyzed: te sarve pratibalāḥ tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ ntarāyam kartum
translated: would not be able to create an obstacle for that bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: dvābhyāṃ subhūte dharmābhyāṃ samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo /
analyzed: dvābhyām subhūte dharmābhyām samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses two dharmas

original: durdharṣo bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ / katamābhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ /
analyzed: durdharṣaḥ bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ katamābhyām dvābhyām
translated: is difficult for Māra and the evil ones to assail. What are the two?

original: sarvadharmāś ca śūnyatāto vyavalokitā bhavanti /🔽sarvasattvāś cāparityaktā bhavanti / ābhyāṃ subhūte dvābhyāṃ dharmābhyāṃ samanvāgato
analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ ca śūnyatātaḥ vyavalokitāḥ bhavanti  sarva sattvāḥ ca a parityaktāḥ bhavanti ābhyām subhūte dvābhyām dharmābhyām samanvāgataḥ
translated: All dharmas are seen as emptiness,🔽and all beings are not abandoned. Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses

original: bodhisattvo mahāsattvo durdharṣo bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyābhiḥ / aparābhyāṃ subhūte dvābhyāṃ🔽dharmābhyāṃ samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran durdharṣo
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ durdharṣaḥ bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyābhiḥ aparābhyām subhūte dvābhyām  dharmābhyām samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran durdharṣo
translated: these two dharmas is difficult for Māra and the evil ones to assail. Furthermore, Subhūti,🔽a bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses two dharmas, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, is difficult for Māra and the evil ones to assail.

original: bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ / katamābhyāṃ dvābhyām /
analyzed: bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ katamābhyām dvābhyām
translated: What are the two?

original: yathāvādī tathākārī ca bhavati buddhāṃś ca bhagavataḥ samanvāharati / ābhyāṃ subhūte
analyzed: yathāvādī tathākārī ca bhavati buddhān ca bhagavataḥ samanvāharati ābhyām subhūte
translated: He is one who acts as he speaks, and he keeps in mind the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones. Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses

original: dvābhyāṃ dharmābhyāṃ samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran
analyzed: dvābhyām dharmābhyām samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran
translated: these two dharmas, while practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: durdharṣo bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ / evañ carataḥ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
analyzed: durdharṣaḥ bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ evam carataḥ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: He becomes invincible to the evil Māras. Subhūti, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices like this,

original: te devaputrā upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante paryupāsyante paripraśnayanti /🔽utsāhañ ca dadāti /
analyzed: te deva putrāḥ upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante paryupāsyante paripraśnayanti  utsāham ca dadāti
translated: those gods will want to approach, attend upon, and ask questions of him.

original: kṣipraṃ tvaṃ kulaputra buddhabodhiṃ samanuprāpsyasi tasmāt tarhi tvaṃ kulaputra etenaiva vihāreṇa vihara yad uta śūnyatāvihāreṇānimittavihāreṇāpraṇihitavihāreṇa /
analyzed: kṣipram tvam kula putra buddha bodhim samanuprāpsyasi tasmāt tarhi tvam kula putra etena eva vihāreṇa vihara yat uta śūnyatā vihāreṇa animitta vihāreṇa apraṇihita vihāreṇa
translated: And they will give encouragement, saying, 'You will quickly attain the enlightenment of the Buddhas, O son of good family. Therefore, O son of good family, dwell in this very abode, namely, the abode of emptiness, the abode of signlessness, and the abode of wishlessness.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: etena tvaṃ kulaputra vihāreṇa viharann anāthānāṃ sattvānāṃ nātho bhaviṣyasi /
analyzed: etena tvam kula putra vihāreṇa viharan anāthānām sattvānām nāthaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: Dwelling in this abode, O son of good family, you will be a protector for beings without a protector.

original: asaraṇānāṃ śaraṇaṃ bhaviṣyasi /🔽atrāṇānāṃ sattvānāṃ trāṇaṃ bhaviṣyasi /🔽aparāyaṇānāṃ sattvānāṃ parāyaṇaṃ bhaviṣyasi /
analyzed: asaraṇānām śaraṇam bhaviṣyasi  atrāṇānām sattvānām trāṇam bhaviṣyasi  aparāyaṇānām sattvānām parāyaṇam bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will be a refuge for those without a refuge.🔽You will be a haven for beings without a haven.

original: alayanānāṃ sattvānāṃ layanaṃ bhaviṣyasi /🔽advīpānāṃ sattvānāṃ dvīpo bhaviṣyasi /
analyzed: a layanānām sattvānām layanam bhaviṣyasi  a dvīpānām sattvānām dvīpaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will be a final relief for beings without final relief.🔽You will be a light for beings in darkness.

original: andhabhūtānāṃ sattvānām āloko bhaviṣyasi / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: andha bhūtānām sattvānām ālokaḥ bhaviṣyasi tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: etena hi prajñāpāramitāvihāreṇāvirahitasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāmī guṇā bhavanti /
analyzed: etena hi prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa avirahitasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya amī guṇāḥ bhavanti
translated: Because these are the qualities of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is not separated from this dwelling in the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye 'pi te 'saṃkhyeyeṣv aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantas tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti te 'pi bhikṣusaṃghaparivṛtā buddhā bhagavanto🔽yo 'sau prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caraty etair eva guṇaiḥ samanvāgato yad uta prajñāpāramitāguṇais
analyzed: ye pi te saṃkhyeyeṣu aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti te pi bhikṣu saṃgha parivṛtāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ  yaḥ sau prajñāpāramitāyām carati etaiḥ eva guṇaiḥ samanvāgataḥ yat uta prajñāpāramitā guṇaiḥ
translated: And those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who are in the innumerable, immeasurable world systems, they, the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, surrounded by the community of monks,

original: tasya te buddhā bhagavanto nāmaṃ ca gotraṃ ca parikīrtayamānarūpā dharmaṃ deśayanty udānaṃ codānayanti /🔽tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tadyathāpi nāmāham etarhi ratnaketor bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpo dharmaṃ
analyzed: tasya te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nāmam ca gotram ca parikīrtayamāna rūpāḥ dharmam deśayanti udānam ca udānayanti  tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tat yathā api nāma aham etarhi ratnaketoḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpaḥ dharmam
translated: they, the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma, and utter cries of joy, while proclaiming the name and clan of that one who courses in the perfection of wisdom, endowed with these very qualities, namely the qualities of the perfection of wisdom.🔽And those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma, and utter cries of joy, while proclaiming the name and clan of that bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: deśayāmy udānaṃ codānayāmi /
analyzed: deśayāmi udānam ca udānayāmi
translated: Just as now I teach the Dharma, and utter cries of joy, while proclaiming the name and clan of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ratnaketu.

original: śikhinaś ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpo dharmaṃ deśayāmy udānaṃ codānayāmi /
analyzed: śikhinaḥ ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpaḥ dharmam deśayāmi udānam ca udānayāmi
translated: I teach the Dharma and utter cries of excitement, taking the form of proclaiming the names of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Śikhin.

original: ye 'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsatttvā akṣobhyasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntike brahmacaryaṃ caranti /
analyzed: ye pi te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ akṣobhyasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antike brahmacaryam caranti
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice celibacy in the presence of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Akṣobhya,

original: anayā ca prajñāpāramitayāvirahitās teṣām ahaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpo dharmaṃ deśayāmy udānaṃ codānayāmi /
analyzed: anayā ca prajñāpāramitayā avirahitāḥ teṣām aham bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpaḥ dharmam deśayāmi udānam ca udānayāmi
translated: and who are not separated from this perfection of wisdom, I teach the Dharma and utter cries of excitement, taking the form of proclaiming the names of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: ye 'pi te pūrvasyāṃ diśi buddhā bhagavantas tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmaṃ ca deśayanti /
analyzed: ye pi te pūrvasyām diśi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: Those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who are present, remain, and live in the eastern direction,

original: tatra ye bodhisattvā mahāsattvā brahmacaryaṃ caranti /🔽anayā prajñāpāramitayāvirahitās teṣāṃ te buddhā bhagavanto nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpā
analyzed: tatra ye bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ brahmacaryam caranti  anayā prajñāpāramitayā avirahitāḥ teṣām te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpā
translated: and those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice celibacy there,🔽not separated from this perfection of wisdom, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma and utter cries of excitement, taking the form of proclaiming their names.

original: dharmaṃ deśayaty udānaṃ codānayanti / evaṃ dakṣiṇasyāṃ paścimāyām uttarasyām adha
analyzed: dharmam deśayati udānam ca udānayanti evam dakṣiṇasyām paścimāyām uttarasyām adha
translated: In the same way, in the southern, western, northern,

original: ūrdhvam atra vidikṣu lokadhātuṣu /
analyzed: ūrdhvam atra vidikṣu lokadhātuṣu
translated: Above, in the world systems in the intermediate directions.

original: ye buddhā bhagavantas tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmaṃ ca deśayanti /
analyzed: ye buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: Those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who abide, maintain themselves, and teach the Dharma.

original: tatra ye bodhisattvā mahāsattvā brahmacaryaṃ caranti /
analyzed: tatra ye bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ brahmacaryam caranti
translated: There, those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas who practice the holy life,

original: anayā prajñāpāramitayāvirahitās teṣāṃ te buddhā bhagavanto nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpā dharmaṃ deśayanty udānaṃ codānayanti /
analyzed: anayā prajñāpāramitayā avirahitāḥ teṣām te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpāḥ dharmam deśayanti udānam ca udānayanti
translated: not separated from this perfection of wisdom, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma while proclaiming their names and utter exclamations of joy.

original: ye 'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prathamacittotpādam upādāya bodhisattvamārgaṃ paripūrayamāṇā yāvat sarvākārajñatām anuprāpsyanti /
analyzed: ye pi te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prathama citta utpādam upādāya bodhisattva mārgam paripūrayamāṇāḥ yāvat sarva ākāra jña tām anuprāpsyanti
translated: Those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas who, beginning with the first production of the thought of enlightenment, are fulfilling the Bodhisattva path up to the attainment of omniscience,

original: teṣām api te buddhā bhagavanto nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpā dharmaṃ deśayanty udānaṃ codānayanti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: teṣām api te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpāḥ dharmam deśayanti udānam ca udānayanti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: for them also those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma while proclaiming their names and utter exclamations of joy. Why is that?

original: evaṃ duṣkarakārakā hi subhūte bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bhavanti /
analyzed: evam duṣkara kārakāḥ hi subhūte bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhavanti
translated: Because, Subhuti, those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas are the ones who are difficult to surpass,

original: ye buddhanetryavyavacchedāya pratipannāḥ /
analyzed: ye buddha netrī a vyavacchedāya pratipannāḥ
translated: who are intent on not cutting off the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhuti said to the Blessed One:

original: katameṣāṃ bhagavan bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpās te buddhā bhagavanto dharmaṃ deśayanty udānaṃ codānayanti vinivartanīyānāṃ
analyzed: katameṣām bhagavan bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpāḥ te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ dharmam deśayanti udānam ca udānayanti vinivartanīyānām
translated: Blessed One, the names of which bodhisattva mahāsattvas do those Buddhas and Blessed Ones mention and teach the Dharma and utter the utterance for those who are turning back?🔽

original: vā avinivartanīyānāṃ vā /
analyzed: vā a vinivartanīyānām vā
translated: Which bodhisattva mahāsattvas are those whose names the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, proclaim while teaching the Dharma and uttering forth praises, whether they are reversible or irreversible?

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: Thus addressed, the Blessed One said this to the venerable Subhūti:

original: santi subhūte bodhisattvā mahāsattvā avinivartanīyā ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranti /
analyzed: santi subhūte bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ a vinivartanīyāḥ ye prajñāpāramitāyām caranti
translated: Subhūti, there are irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: santi vinivartanīyā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranti /
analyzed: santi vinivartanīyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye prajñāpāramitāyām caranti
translated: There are reversible bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: yeṣāṃ te buddhā bhagavanto nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpā dharmaṃ deśayanty udānaṃ🔽codānayanti / ye 'pi te ratnaketor bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyānuśikṣamāṇarūpā bodhisattvacārikāṃ
analyzed: yeṣām te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpāḥ dharmam deśayanti udānam  codānayanti ye pi te ratnaketoḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anuśikṣamāṇa rūpāḥ bodhisattva cārikām
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma and utter forth praises, proclaiming the names of those whose names they proclaim while teaching the Dharma and uttering forth praises.

original: caranti teṣāṃ te buddhā bhagavanto nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpā dharmaṃ deśayanty udānaṃ codānayanti /
analyzed: caranti teṣām te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpāḥ dharmam deśayanti udānam ca udānayanti
translated: Those who, like the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ratnaketu, practice the bodhisattva conduct while training, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma and utter forth praises, proclaiming their names while teaching the Dharma and uttering forth praises.🔽Thus addressed, the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte ye 'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranti /🔽sarvadharmā anutpattikā ity adhimuktā na cānutpattikair /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte ye pi te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caranti  sarva dharmāḥ anutpattikāḥ iti adhimuktāḥ na ca anutpattikaiḥ
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, those bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: dharmaiḥ kṣāntiḥ pratilabdhā /
analyzed: dharmaiḥ kṣāntiḥ pratilabdhā
translated: who are convinced that all dharmas are non-arisen, but have not attained acceptance of non-arisen dharmas,

original: sarvadharmāḥ śūnyā ity adhimuktā na cānutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntiḥ pratilabdhā /
analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ śūnyāḥ iti adhimuktāḥ na ca anutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntiḥ pratilabdhā
translated: who are convinced that all dharmas are empty, but have not attained acceptance of non-arisen dharmas,

original: sarvadharmāḥ śāntā ity adhimuktāḥ sarvadharmā vigatā iti tucchakā iti vaśikā ity asārakā ity adhimuktā na cānutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntiḥ pratilabdhā /🔽eṣāṃ subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ te buddhā bhagavanto nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpā dharmaṃ deśayanty udānaṃ codānayanti /
analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ śāntāḥ iti adhimuktāḥ sarva dharmāḥ vigatāḥ iti tucchakāḥ iti vaśikāḥ iti asārakāḥ iti adhimuktāḥ na ca anutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntiḥ pratilabdhā  eṣām subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpāḥ dharmam deśayanti udānam ca udānayanti
translated: who are convinced that all dharmas are calm, that all dharmas are isolated, that all dharmas are void, that all dharmas are insubstantial, but have not attained acceptance of non-arisen dharmas,🔽those bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, Subhūti, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma while proclaiming their names and utter exclamations of joy.

original: yeṣāṃ te subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ buddhā bhagavanto nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūupā dharmaṃ deśayanty udānaṃ codānayanti /
analyzed: yeṣām te subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nāmadheyam dharmam deśayanti udānam ca udānayanti
translated: Those bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, Subhūti, whose names those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, proclaim while teaching the Dharma and uttering exclamations of joy,

original: teṣām api subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prahīṇā śrāvakabhūmiś ca pratyekabuddhabhūmiś ca pratikāṅkṣitavyā /
analyzed: teṣām api subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prahīṇā śrāvaka bhūmiḥ ca pratyekabuddha bhūmiḥ ca pratikāṅkṣitavyā
translated: Subhūti, it should be expected that those bodhisattva great beings will have given up the śrāvaka level and the pratyekabuddha level.

original: vyākriyante ca te 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: vyākriyante ca te nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And they will be prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yasya subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato buddhā bhagavanto nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānarūpā dharmaṃ deśayanty udānaṃ
analyzed: yasya subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nāmadheyam parikīrtayamāna rūpāḥ dharmam deśayanti udānam
translated: Subhūti, when the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teaching the Dharma in the form of proclaiming the name of a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'vinivartanīyatāyāṃ sthāsyati yatra sthitvā sarvākārajñatām anuprāpsyati /
analyzed: sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vinivartanīya tāyām sthāsyati yatra sthitvā sarva ākāra jña tām anuprāpsyati
translated: that bodhisattva great being will stand in the state of irreversibility, standing in which he will reach the knowledge of all aspects.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvā mahāsattvā gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ🔽śrutvā na kāṅkṣiṣyanti na vicikitsiṣyanti na dhandhāyiṣyanti / evam etad yathā tathāgatenārhatā
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām  śrutvā na kāṅkṣiṣyanti na vicikitsiṣyanti na dhandhāyiṣyanti evam etat yathā tathāgatena arhatā
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when the profound perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhena bhāṣitety adhimokṣyante bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhena bhāṣitā iti adhimokṣyante bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: having heard it, the bodhisattva great beings will not doubt, will not be uncertain, will not be confused. They will believe, 'It is just as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has said,' and will fully awaken to awakening.

original: kas tatra sthitvā dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ tatra sthitvā dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: Who, standing there, will teach the Dharma?

original: nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate /
analyzed: na idam sthānam vidyate
translated: This is not possible.

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: gambhīreyaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitā duṣkarakārakā bhagavan bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhukāmāḥ / tat kasya
analyzed: gambhīrā iyam bhagavan prajñāpāramitā duṣkara kārakāḥ bhagavan bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmāḥ tat kasya
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is profound. Blessed One, those bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are doers of what is hard. Why is that?

original: na ca nāma bhagavan kaścit tathatāyāṃ tiṣṭhati nāpi kaścid anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: na ca nāma bhagavan kaścid tathatāyām tiṣṭhati na api kaścid anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: Blessed One, indeed no one stands in the suchness, and no one fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: abhisaṃbudhyate nāpi kaścid dharmaṃ deśayati / atha ca nāvalīyate na cāsya kāṅkṣāyitatvaṃ
analyzed: abhisaṃbudhyate na api kaścid dharmam deśayati atha ca na avalīyate na ca asya kāṅkṣāyita tvam
translated: and no one teaches the Dharma. Still, one does not shrink back, and one does not have doubt

original: vā dhandhāyitatvaṃ vā bhavati / iti prajñaptisahāryapudgalādhiṣṭhāno dvitiyo grāhakavikalpaḥ
analyzed: vā dhandhāyita tvam vā bhavati iti prajñapti saha ārya pudgala adhiṣṭhānaḥ dvitiyaḥ grāhaka vikalpaḥ
translated: or hesitation. Thus the second conceptualization of the grasper, based on the person who is associated with designation, is complete.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then indeed the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: kathaṃ bhagavan māyopamaṃ cittam anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate /
analyzed: katham bhagavat māyā upamam cittam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: Blessed One, how does a mind that is like an illusion fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: When that was said, the Blessed One said this to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: tat kim manyase
translated: What do you think?

original: subhūte samanupaśyasi tvaṃ taṃ māyopamaṃ cittam /
analyzed: subhūte samanupaśyasi tvam tam māyā upamam cittam
translated: Subhūti, do you see that mind which is like an illusion?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: na bhagavan /
analyzed: na bhagavan
translated: No, Blessed One.

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan māyopamaṃ cittaṃ samanupaśyāmi /
analyzed: na aham bhagavat māyā upamam cittam samanupaśyāmi
translated: Blessed One, I do not see a mind which is like an illusion.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: tat kim manyase
translated: What do you think, Subhūti?

original: subhūte yatra na māyā /
analyzed: subhūte yatra na māyā
translated: Where there is no illusion,

original: na māyopamaṃ cittaṃ tatra samanupaśyasi tvaṃ cittam /
analyzed: na māyā upamam cittam tatra samanupaśyasi tvam cittam
translated: and no mind like an illusion, do you see there a mind?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: na bhagavan /
analyzed: na bhagavan
translated: No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: tat kim manyase
translated: What do you think, Subhūti?

original: subhūte 'nyatra māyāyā māyopamād vā cittāt taṃ dharmaṃ samanupaśyasi yo dharmo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: subhūte nyatra māyāyāḥ māyā upamāt vā cittāt tam dharmam samanupaśyasi yaḥ dharmaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Do you see that dharma apart from the illusion or the mind like an illusion, which dharma will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: na bhagavan /
analyzed: na bhagavan
translated: No, Blessed One.

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan anyatra māyāyā māyopamād vā cittāt taṃ dharmaṃ samanupaśyāmi yo dharmo
analyzed: na aham bhagavan anyatra māyāyāḥ māyā upamāt vā cittāt tam dharmam samanupaśyāmi yaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, I do not see that dharma apart from the illusion or the mind like an illusion, which dharma

original: 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate / so 'haṃ bhagavann anyaṃ dharmaṃ na samanupaśyan
analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate saḥ ham bhagavan anyam dharmam na samanupaśyan
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. Blessed One, not seeing any other dharma,

original: tatkatamaṃ dharmam upadekṣyāmy asti vā nāsti veti /
analyzed: tat katamam dharmam upadekṣyāmi asti vā na asti vā iti
translated: what dharma shall I teach as existent or non-existent?

original: yo dharmo 'tyantatayā vivikto na so 'stitāṃ vā nāstitāṃ vopaiti /
analyzed: yaḥ dharmaḥ tyanta tayā viviktaḥ na saḥ stitām vā na astitām vā upaiti
translated: A dharma that is utterly isolated does not approach existence or non-existence.

original: yo dharmo 'tyantatayā vivikto na so 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: yaḥ dharmaḥ tyanta tayā viviktaḥ na saḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: A dharma that is utterly isolated will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: na cāsaṃvidyamāno dharmo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbohotsyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na ca a saṃvidyamānaḥ dharmaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And a dharma that does not exist will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. Why is that?

original: tathā hi bhagavaṃs te dharmā na saṃvidyante ye saṃkliśyeyur vyavadāyeyur vā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan te dharmāḥ na saṃvidyante ye saṃkliśyeyuḥ vyavadāyeyuḥ vā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because, Blessed One, those dharmas do not exist that would be defiled or purified. Why is that?

original: tathā hi bhagavan prajñāpāramitātyantaviviktā /🔽dhyānapāramitātyantaviviktā vīryapāramitātyantaviviktā /
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan prajñāpāramitā atyanta viviktā  dhyāna pāramitā atyanta viviktā vīrya pāramitā atyanta viviktā
translated: Because, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is utterly isolated.🔽The perfection of concentration is utterly isolated, the perfection of perseverance is utterly isolated,

original: kṣāntipāramitātyantaviviktā /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitā atyanta viviktā
translated: the perfection of patience is utterly isolated,

original: śīlapāramitātyantaviviktā /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā atyanta viviktā
translated: the perfection of morality is utterly isolated,

original: dānapāramitātyantaviviktā /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā atyanta viviktā
translated: the perfection of giving is utterly isolated.

original: evam adhyātmaśūnyatātryantaviviktā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatātyantaviviktā /
analyzed: evam adhyātma śūnyatā tri anta viviktā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā atyanta viviktā
translated: In the same way, inner emptiness is utterly isolated, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is utterly isolated.

original: smṛtyupasthānasamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgā atyantaviviktāḥ /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgāḥ atyanta viviktāḥ
translated: The applications of mindfulness, right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path are utterly isolated.

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattyāryasatyāny atyantaviviktāni /
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti ārya satyāni atyanta viviktāni
translated: The immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments are utterly isolated.🔽The noble truths are utterly isolated.

original: sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhāny atyantaviviktāni /
analyzed: sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukhāni atyanta viviktāni
translated: The liberations, concentrations, attainments, and dhāraṇī gateways are utterly isolated.

original: pañcābhijñā atyantaviviktā /
analyzed: pañca abhijñā atyanta viviktā
translated: The five higher knowledges are utterly isolated.

original: daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikābuddhadharmā atyantaviviktāḥ /
analyzed: daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇikā buddha dharmāḥ atyanta viviktāḥ
translated: The ten powers, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, and unique qualities of a buddha are utterly isolated.

original: anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhir apy atyantaviviktā /
analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhiḥ api atyanta viviktā
translated: Supreme perfect enlightenment is utterly isolated.

original: yaś cātyantavivikto dharmo na sa bhāvayitavyo vā vibhāvayitavyo vā /
analyzed: yaḥ ca atyanta viviktaḥ dharmaḥ na sa bhāvayitavyaḥ vā vibhāvayitavyaḥ vā
translated: And a dharma that is utterly isolated should not be cultivated or manifested.

original: nāpi kasyacid dharmasyāhārikā prajñāpāramitātyantaviviktatvād /
analyzed: nā api kasyacid dharmasya āhārikā prajñāpāramitā atyanta vivikta tvāt
translated: And the perfection of wisdom does not bring about any dharma at all, because it is utterly isolated.

original: yady atyantaviviktā prajñāpāramitā tat kathaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitam āgamya bodhisattvo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: yadi atyanta viviktā prajñāpāramitā tat katham bhagavan prajñāpāramitam āgamya bodhisattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: If the perfection of wisdom is utterly isolated, Blessed One, how will a bodhisattva, relying on the perfection of wisdom, fully awaken to supreme perfect enlightenment?

original: anuttarāpi samyaksaṃbodhir atyantaviviktā /
analyzed: anuttarā api samyaksaṃbodhiḥ atyanta viviktā
translated: Supreme perfect enlightenment is also utterly isolated.

original: kathaṃ viviktena viviktasyānubodhau bhavati /
analyzed: katham viviktena viviktasya anubodhau bhavati
translated: How can the isolated fully awaken to the isolated?

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: sādhu sādhu /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu
translated: Good, good!

original: subhūte evam etat /
analyzed: subhūte evam etat
translated: Subhūti, it is so!

original: atyantaviviktā hi subhūte prajñapāramitā /🔽'tyantaviviktā dhyānapāramitā /🔽'tyantaviviktā vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: atyanta viviktā hi subhūte prajñapāramitā  tyanta viviktā dhyāna pāramitā  tyanta viviktā vīrya pāramitā
translated: For, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is utterly isolated.🔽The perfection of concentration is utterly isolated.🔽The perfection of perseverance is utterly isolated.

original: 'tyantaviviktā kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: tyanta viviktā kṣānti pāramitā
translated: The perfection of patience is utterly isolated.

original: 'tyantaviviktā śīlapāramitā /
analyzed: tyanta viviktā śīla pāramitā
translated: The perfection of morality is utterly isolated.

original: 'tyantaviviktā dānapāramitā /
analyzed: tyanta viviktā dāna pāramitā
translated: The perfection of giving is utterly isolated.

original: atyantaviviktāḥ sarvaśūnyatāḥ /
analyzed: atyanta viviktāḥ sarva śūnyatāḥ
translated: All emptinesses are utterly isolated.

original: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmā apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattaya āryasatyāni śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāny
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ ārya satyāni śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless attainments, the noble truths, the emptiness, signless, and wishless [gates to liberation],

original: abhijñāḥ sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhadaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmā atyantaviviktā /🔽anuttarā samayaksaṃbodhir atyantaviviktā yāvat sarvākārajñatā atyantaviviktā / yathā
analyzed: abhijñāḥ sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukha daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ atyanta viviktā  anuttarā samayaksaṃbodhiḥ atyanta viviktā yāvat sarva ākārajña tā atyanta viviktā yathā
translated: the superknowledges, all liberations, concentrations, attainments, dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the unique qualities of a buddha are utterly isolated.🔽Supreme perfect enlightenment is utterly isolated, up to omniscience is utterly isolated.

original: subhūte 'tyantaviviktā prajñāpāramitā yāvat sarvākārajñatā tathātyantaviviktām anuttarāṃ
analyzed: subhūte tyanta viviktā prajñāpāramitā yāvat sarva ākāra jña tā tathā atyanta viviktām anuttarām
translated: Just as, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is utterly isolated, up to omniscience is utterly isolated, in the same way he will fully awaken to the utterly isolated

original: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: sacet subhūte na prajñāpāramitātyantaviviktābhaviṣyad yāvat sarvākārajñatātyantaviviktā
analyzed: saced subhūte na prajñāpāramitā atyanta viviktā abhaviṣyat yāvat sarva ākārajña tā atyanta viviktā
translated: If, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom were not utterly isolated, up to the knowledge of all aspects were not utterly isolated,

original: bhaviṣyan na prajñāpāramitābhaviṣyad yāvan na sarvākārajñatābhaviṣyad evaṃ na prajñapāramitā /
analyzed: bhaviṣyat na prajñāpāramitā bhaviṣyat yāvat na sarva ākāra jña tā bhaviṣyat evam na prajñapāramitā
translated: if the perfection of wisdom were not, up to the knowledge of all aspects were not, then the perfection of wisdom would not be, up to the knowledge of all aspects would not be.

original: ye ca punar evaṃ śroṣyanti akṣobhyasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntike
analyzed: ye ca punar evam śroṣyanti akṣobhyasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antike
translated: And those who will hear this profound perfection of wisdom from the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, Akṣobhya,

original: gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ teṣāṃ ca bodhisattvayānikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ cāntikād /
analyzed: gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām teṣām ca bodhisattva yānikānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca antikāt
translated: and from those sons of good family and daughters of good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle,

original: ayam api bodhisattvayānikaḥ pudgala imāṃ prajñāpāramitām adhimokṣyate /
analyzed: ayam api bodhisattva yānikaḥ pudgalaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām adhimokṣyate
translated: this person in the Bodhisattva Vehicle will also believe in this perfection of wisdom.

original: imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ yathā tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena bhāṣitā tathādhimucyamāno 'vinivartanīyatāyāṃ sthāsyati /
analyzed: imām prajñāpāramitām yathā tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena bhāṣitā tathā adhimucyamānaḥ vinivartanīya tāyām sthāsyati
translated: Convinced of this perfection of wisdom just as it was taught by the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, he will stand in irreversibility.

original: evaṃ bahukaraṃ subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ śravaṇaṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: evam bahukaram subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitāyāḥ śravaṇam vadāmi
translated: In this way, Subhūti, I say that hearing the perfection of wisdom is very helpful for the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: kaḥ punar vādo ye 'dhimokṣyante 'dhimucya tathatvāya sthāsyanti tathatvāya pratipatsyante tathatvāya sthitvā tathatvāya pratipadyamānās tiṣṭhanti
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ ye dhimokṣyante dhimucya tathatvāya sthāsyanti tathatvāya pratipatsyante tathatvāya sthitvā tathatvāya pratipadyamānāḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: What to speak of those who will have faith, and having faith, will stand in suchness, will practice for suchness, and having stood in suchness, will practice for suchness, and will stand?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: yat punar bhagavaṃs tathatāyāṃ sthitvā tathatāyāṃ pratipadyamāno na kaścid dharmam upalabhate tadā kathaṃ tiṣṭhati sarvākārajñatāyām /
analyzed: yat punar bhagavan tathatāyām sthitvā tathatāyām pratipadyamānaḥ na kaścid dharmam upalabhate tadā katham tiṣṭhati sarva ākārajña tāyām
translated: But when, Blessed One, standing in suchness and practicing for suchness, one does not apprehend any dharma at all, then how does one stand in the knowledge of all aspects?

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: yathā subhūte tathāgatanirmitas tiṣṭhati tathā tiṣṭhati sarvākārajñatāyām /
analyzed: yathā subhūte tathāgata nirmitaḥ tiṣṭhati tathā tiṣṭhati sarva ākārajña tāyām
translated: Just as, Subhūti, the Tathāgata's magical creation stands, so does one stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: yat punar bhagavaṃs tathāgatanirmito na kaścid dharmam upalabhate /
analyzed: yat punar bhagavan tathāgata nirmitaḥ na kaścid dharmam upalabhate
translated: But, Blessed One, when the Tathāgata's magical creation does not apprehend any dharma at all,

original: ko 'yaṃ tathatāyāṃ tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: kaḥ yam tathatāyām tiṣṭhati
translated: who is this who stands in suchness?

original: ko vā tathatāyāṃ sthitvānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: kaḥ vā tathatāyām sthitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Or who will awaken to highest genuine full Awakening having stood in suchness?

original: ko vā tathatāyāṃ sthitvā dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ vā tathatāyām sthitvā dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: Or who, having stood in suchness, will teach the Dharma?

original: tathataiva tāvan nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathatā eva tāvat na upalabhyate
translated: Suchness itself is not apprehended,

original: kaḥ punar vādo yas tathatāyāṃ sthāsyati /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ tathatāyām sthāsyati
translated: how much less so someone who will stand in suchness,

original: tathatāyāṃ sthitvānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate tathatāyāṃ sthitvā dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: tathatāyām sthitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate tathatāyām sthitvā dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: or who, standing in suchness, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, or who, standing in suchness, will teach the Dharma.

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: yadāyuṣmān subhūtir evam āha /
analyzed: yadā āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ evam āha
translated: What the venerable Subhūti has said,

original: tathāgatanirmito na kaścid dharmam upalabhate ko 'yaṃ tathatāyāṃ tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: tathāgata nirmitaḥ na kaścid dharmam upalabhate kaḥ yam tathatāyām tiṣṭhati
translated: that the Tathāgata's magical creation does not apprehend any dharma at all, who will stand in suchness,

original: ko vā tathatāyāṃ sthitvānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: kaḥ vā tathatāyām sthitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: who will stand in suchness and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: ko yā tathatāyāṃ sthitvā dharman deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ yā tathatāyām sthitvā dharman deśayiṣyati
translated: who will stand in suchness and teach the Dharma.

original: tathataiva tāvan nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathatā eva tāvat na upalabhyate
translated: Suchness itself is not apprehended,

original: kaḥ punar vādo yas tathatāyāṃ sthāsyati tathatāyāṃ sthitvānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate tathatāyāṃ sthitvā dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati / 🔽evam etat subhūte evam etat /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ tathatāyām sthāsyati tathatāyām sthitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate tathatāyām sthitvā dharmam deśayiṣyati  / evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: how much less so someone who will stand in suchness, stand in suchness and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, stand in suchness and teach the Dharma.

original: tathā yathā vadasi /
analyzed: tathā yathā vadasi
translated: It is just as you have said, Subhūti, it is just as you have said.🔽It is just as you have said.

original: na subhūte tathāgatanirmitaḥ kaścid dharmam upalabhate yas tathatāyāṃ sthāsyati yas tathatāyāṃ sthitvānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: na subhūte tathāgata nirmitaḥ kaścid dharmam upalabhate yaḥ tathatāyām sthāsyati yaḥ tathatāyām sthitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata’s emanation does not apprehend any dharma at all that would stand in suchness, or having stood in suchness would fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: yas tathatāyāṃ sthitvā dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati tathataiva tāvan nopalabhyate /
analyzed: yaḥ tathatāyām sthitvā dharmam deśayiṣyati tathatā eva tāvat na upalabhyate
translated: or having stood in suchness would teach the Dharma. Suchness itself is not even apprehended.

original: kaḥ punar vādo yas tathatāyāṃ sthāsyati tathatāyāṃ sthitvānuttarāṃ samysaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate tathatāyāṃ sthitvā dharmaṃ deśayiṣyantiti /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ tathatāyām sthāsyati tathatāyām sthitvā anuttarām samysaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate tathatāyām sthitvā dharmam deśayiṣyanti iti
translated: How much less so would someone stand in suchness, or having stood in suchness would fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, or having stood in suchness would teach the Dharma?

original: nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na idam sthānam vidyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: This is not possible. Why is that?

original: utpādād vā subhūte tathāgatānām anutpādād vā tathāgatānāṃ sthitaivaiṣā tathatā avitathatā ananyatathatā dharmatā dharmadhātur dharmasthititā
analyzed: utpādāt vā subhūte tathāgatānām anutpādāt vā tathāgatānām sthitā eva eṣā tathatā avitathatā ananya tathatā dharma tā dharma dhātuḥ dharma sthiti tā
translated: Subhūti, whether the Tathāgatas arise or whether the Tathāgatas do not arise, this suchness of dharmas, non-falseness of dharmas, unaltered suchness of dharmas, dharma-constituent, establishment of dharmas,

original: dharmaniyāmatā bhūtakoṭir /
translated: way of dharmas, fixed sequence of dharmas, reality limit remains just as it is.

original: neha subhūte tathatāyāṃ kaścit tiṣṭhati na tathatāyāṃ kaścid anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate na tathatāyāṃ kaścid dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: na iha subhūte tathatāyām kaścid tiṣṭhati na tathatāyām kaścid anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate na tathatāyām kaścid dharmam deśayati
translated: Subhūti, in this suchness no one stands, in suchness no one fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, in suchness no one teaches the Dharma.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na hy atra tathatāyāṃ dharma upalabhyate /
analyzed: na hi atra tathatāyām dharmaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because in this suchness no dharma is apprehended,

original: yo vā tathatāyāṃ tiṣṭhet /
analyzed: yaḥ vā tathatāyām tiṣṭhet
translated: whether one who stands in suchness,

original: yo vā tathatāyāṃ sthitvānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: yaḥ vā tathatāyām sthitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: or one who, having stood in suchness, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: yo vā tathatāyā sthitvā dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vā tathatāyāḥ sthitvā dharmam deśayiṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: or one who, having stood in suchness, will teach the Dharma. Why is that?

original: tathataiva tāvan nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathatā eva tāvat na upalabhyate
translated: Even suchness itself is not apprehended,

original: naivāsyotpāda upalabhyate na vyayo na sthitir nānyathātvam / yatrāsya dharmasya notpāda upalabhyate na vyayo na sthitir nānyathātvaṃ /
analyzed: na eva asya utpādaḥ upalabhyate na vyayaḥ na sthitiḥ na anyathātvam yatra asya dharmasya na utpādaḥ upalabhyate na vyayaḥ na sthitiḥ na anyathātvam
translated: where the arising of this dharma is not apprehended, its passing away is not apprehended, its abiding is not apprehended, and its alteration is not apprehended.

original: kas tatra sthāsyati /
analyzed: kaḥ tatra sthāsyati
translated: Who will stand there?

original: ko vā tatra sthitvā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: kaḥ vā tatra sthitvā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Or who, having stood there, will the bodhisattva mahāsattva fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: tasmāt tarhi subhūte prajñāpāramitātyantaviviktā yāvat sarvākārajñatātyantaviviktā /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte prajñāpāramitā atyanta viviktā yāvat sarva ākāra jña tā atyanta viviktā
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is utterly isolated, up to the knowledge of all aspects is utterly isolated.

original: tasmāt subhūte prajñapāramitām āgamya bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: tasmāt subhūte prajñapāramitām āgamya bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, relying on the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva mahāsattva will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca vivekena viveko 'bhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: na ca vivekena vivekaḥ abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: And yet isolation will not fully awaken to isolation.

original: abhisaṃbhotsyate ca /
analyzed: abhisaṃbhotsyate ca
translated: And it will fully awaken.

original: na ca tām anāgamya prajñāpāramitām abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: na ca tām an āgamya prajñāpāramitām abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: And without relying on that perfection of wisdom, it will not fully awaken.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: gambhīre bhagavann arthe carati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: gambhīre bhagavan arthe carati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices in the profound meaning.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat subhūte evam etat /
analyzed: evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: It is so, Subhūti, it is so.

original: gambhīre 'rthe carati bodhisattvo mahāsattvo /🔽duṣkarakārakaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo /
analyzed: gambhīre rthe carati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ  duṣkara kārakaḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva practices in the profound meaning.

original: yo gambhīre 'rthe carati /
analyzed: yaḥ gambhīre rthe carati
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices in the profound meaning is one who does the difficult.

original: tañ cārthaṃ na sākṣātkaroti yad uta śrāvakabhūmiṃ vā pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ vā /
analyzed: tam ca artham na sākṣātkaroti yat uta śrāvaka bhūmim vā pratyekabuddha bhūmim vā
translated: And yet he does not actualize that meaning, namely the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: yathāhaṃ bhagavato bhāṣitasyārtham ājānāmi tathā na kaścid duṣkarakārako bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yathā aham bhagavataḥ bhāṣitasya artham ājānāmi tathā na kaścid duṣkara kārakaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: As I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said, no bodhisattva mahāsattva is a doer of what is difficult. Why is that?

original: tathā hi bhagavan so 'rtho nopalabhyate yaṃ sākṣātkuryāt / sāpi prajñāpāramitā nopalabhyate yayā sākṣātkuryāt /
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan saḥ rthaḥ nā upalabhyate yam sākṣātkuryāt sā api prajñāpāramitā nā upalabhyate yayā sākṣātkuryāt
translated: Because, Blessed One, that object which one might realize is not apprehended, and that perfection of wisdom by which one might realize is also not apprehended.

original: so 'pi dharmo nopalabhyate yaḥ sākṣātkuryād /
analyzed: saḥ pi dharmaḥ na upalabhyate yaḥ sākṣātkuryāt
translated: And that dharma which one might realize is also not apprehended.

original: anupalabhamāno bhagavan sarvadharmāṃs tat katamam arthaṃ sākṣātkariṣyati /
analyzed: an upalabhamānaḥ bhagavan sarva dharmān tat katamam artham sākṣātkariṣyati
translated: Not apprehending any dharmas, Blessed One, what object will one realize?

original: katamāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ sākṣātkariṣyati /
analyzed: katamām prajñāpāramitām sākṣātkariṣyati
translated: What perfection of wisdom will one realize?

original: katamaṃ dharmaṃ sākṣātkariṣyati yaṃ sākṣātkṛtvānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: katamam dharmam sākṣātkariṣyati yam sākṣātkṛtvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: What dharma will one realize by realizing which one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: iyaṃ bhagavann anupalambhacarir bodhisattvacarir yatra caran bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvadharmair anandhakāratām anuprāpnoti /
analyzed: iyam bhagavan anupalambha cariḥ bodhisattva cariḥ yatra caran bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva dharmaiḥ an andhakāra tām anuprāpnoti
translated: Blessed One, this practice of non-apprehension is the practice of the bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing which the bodhisattva attains the absence of darkness with regard to all dharmas.

original: saced bhagavann evaṃ bhāṣyamāṇe bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya cittaṃ nāvalīyate na saṃlīyate na vipratisārī bhavati mānasaṃ nottrasyati na saṃtrasyati
analyzed: saced bhagavan evam bhāṣyamāṇe bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya cittam na avalīyate na saṃlīyate na vipratisārī bhavati mānasam na uttrasyati na saṃtrasyati
translated: If, Blessed One, the mind of a bodhisattva great being does not become cowed, stooped, or regretful, and if his mind does not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified when this is being taught,

original: na saṃtrāsam āpadyate /
analyzed: na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: and if he does not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified when this is being taught,

original: evañ caraṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaś carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: evam caram bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: then, Blessed One, a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: sa caran nimittam api na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: sa caran nimittam api na samanupaśyati
translated: Practicing thus, he does not see even a sign.

original: prajñāpāramitām api na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām api na samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the perfection of wisdom.
